discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Choosing "B" based on ChatGPT:

"To determine the appropriate Prisma SD-WAN license for this site, we need to consider the amount of bandwidth that will be used by the SD-WAN solution in addition to the existing usage of 30 Mbps.

Assuming that the SD-WAN solution will use an additional 10% of bandwidth for overhead and control traffic, we can estimate that the total bandwidth used by the SD-WAN solution will be 33 Mbps (30 Mbps + 10% of 30 Mbps).

Therefore, the remaining bandwidth capacity available for data traffic would be 150 Mbps - 33 Mbps = 117 Mbps.

Based on this information, we would recommend a Prisma SD-WAN license that supports at least 117 Mbps of throughput. However, it's always a good idea to consider future growth and potential increases in bandwidth usage when selecting a license."

questions.question_text:
A customer currently has 150 Mbps of capacity at a site. Records show that, on average, a total of 30 Mbps of bandwidth is used for the two links.
What is the appropriate Prisma SD-WAN license for this site?

questions.question_text: Which product leverages GlobalProtect agents for endpoint visibility and native Prisma SD-WAN integration for remote sites and branches?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It's D, ADEM is available for both RN and MU. Even GP with ADEM can work inside RN and provides insights and metric

Selected Answer: D
D: ADEM

ADEM runs on GlobalProtect for mobile users. It also is integrated into Prisma SD-WAN for Remote Networks and Service Connections.

comments.content:
No... Still should be ADEM
Autonomous Digital Experience Management (ADEM) is a service that provides native end-to-end visibility and performance metrics for real application traffic in your Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) environment. ADEM functionality is natively integrated into the GlobalProtect app, Prisma SD-WAN device, and Prisma Access and therefore does not require you to deploy any additional appliances or agents.
Src: https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/autonomous-dem/administration/autonomous-dem

questions.question_text: Which two key benefits have been identified for a customer investing in the Palo Alto Networks Prisma secure access service edge (SASE) solution? (Choose two.)

choices.A: decreased likelihood of a data breach
choices.D: reduced number of security incidents requiring manual investigation
choices.C: decreased need for interaction between branches
choices.B: reduced input required from management during third-party investigations

choices.B: It allows configuration to forward logs to external logging destinations, such as syslog servers.
choices.D: It provides the ability to push common configurations, configuration updates, and software upgrades to all or a subset of the managed appliances.
choices.C: It steers traffic and defines networking and security policies from an application-centric perspective, rather than a packet-based approach.
choices.A: It enables definition of the privileges and responsibilities of administrative users in a network.
